intro: Coussapoa crassivenosa, commonly known as the thick-veined coussapoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with prominent veins and showy, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
